Type.Name: X509Certificate

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit X509Certificate extends System.Object implements class System.Runtime.Serialization.IDeserializationCallback, class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the <link location="node:gtk-sharp/programming/threads">Gtk# Thread Programming</link> for details.

Docs.summary: This class handle X.509 certificates (version 1, 2 and 3). However in most cases, except for , no validation of the integrity nor the validity of the certificate is done.
Docs.remarks:
The structure of an X.509 certificate is detailled in the document "Internet X.509 Public Key Infrastructure Certificate and CRL Profile" ().
There are some compatibility issues with this class. Microsoft's original class do not support other format except ASN.1 DER encoded certificates, but the mono's implementation support both, ASN.1 DER and PEM format. Developers should take care about this behavior when porting their application to both the .NET and mono platforms.

Docs.param: A byte array containing a single ASN.1 DER or PEM encoded X.509 certificate (see Remarks below).
Docs.summary: Construct an X509Certificate object from an array of bytes.
Docs.remarks: Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM), a.k.a Base64, encoded certificates aren't supported by this constructor (in Microsoft genuine libraries). However, mono's implementation supports PEM and DER encoded format.

Docs.param: Pointer to a CryptoAPI certificate context (PCERT_CONTEXT).
Docs.summary: Construct an X509Certificate object from an CryptoAPI certificate context.
Docs.remarks: As CryptoAPI is only available on Windows this contructor is of limited use.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual byte[] GetCertHash ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance unsigned int8[] GetCertHash() cil managed

Docs.summary: Return a unique hash value for the certificate as an array of bytes.
Docs.returns: Return the SHA1 hash of the complete certificate in a byte array.
Docs.remarks: This is similar to the thumbprint used in many certificate viewers.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string GetCertHashString ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetCertHashString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Return a unique hash value for the certificate as an hexadecimal string.
Docs.returns: Return the SHA1 hash of the complete certificate in a string.
Docs.remarks: This is similar to the thumbprint used in many certificate viewers.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string GetEffectiveDateString ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetEffectiveDateString() cil managed

Docs.returns: To be added: an object of type 'string'

remarks.para: Fx 1.x has a bug where the local time returned is *always* in the Seattle time zone. This is fixed in Fx 2.0.

The method return null if the certificate was created from an Authenticode(r) signature. This can be the case for certificates created using . The timestamp associated with the signature is the guarantee that the certificate was valid at the time of signing (hence it's validity period being hidden).

The method return null if the certificate was created from an Authenticode(r) signature. This can be the case for certificates created using . The timestamp associated with the signature is the guarantee that the certificate was valid at the time of signing (hence it's validity period being hidden).
